business.headline: India's services sector growth jumps to 5-month high in August Despite this, companies in the services sector remained optimistic about future demand, although their confidence dipped to its lowest in over a year.
Sensex, Nifty decline as IT shares plunge; Coal India down over 3%The S&P BSE Sensex was down 404.78 points to 82,150.66 at 10:20 am, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 136.35 points to trade at 25,143.50.

Risk-takers or safety seekers: Deep dive into Gen Z investment trendsAccording to a report by a Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA), 55% of cryptocurrency investors are Gen Zs. Additionally, 41% of investments in stocks and 25% of investments in NFTs are made by Gen Zs.
Intel at risk of losing spot in blue-chip Dow Jones index as shares plungeThe Dow Jones index, known for its price-weighted methodology, is heavily influenced by stock prices.
Sensex, Nifty end flat as investors remain cautious; financials gainThe S&P BSE Sensex closed 4.40 points lower to end at 82,555.44, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 1.15 points to close at 25,279.85.

Are IPO investors selling their stakes too soon? Sebi study reveals key insightsThe study also provided insights into the geographical distribution of IPO investors. It found that about 70% of IPO investors were from the top four states: Gujarat, Maharashtra, Rajasthan, and Uttar Pradesh.

Can Reliance shares outperform Nifty with upcoming bonus issue?Despite RIL's 8% underperformance relative to the Nifty so far this quarter, and being underweight among mutual funds compared to its NSE200 weight, there are signs of resilience.
Explained: Why Goldman Sachs sees gold as top investment choiceGoldman Sachs has adjusted its gold price target to $2,700, expecting it to reach this level by early 2025 instead of the end of 2024.
Explained: Why Matrimony.com shares hit 52-week high in early tradeMatrimony.com shares were up 11.26% to Rs 828.95 on the Bombay Stock Exchange at 1:44 pm.
Explained: Why GMR Power shares jumped 5% todayGMP Power share price: Year-to-date, the midcap stock has soared by 140%, and on August 30, it hit a 52-week high of Rs 140 per share.

Aadhaar Housing Finance shares jump over 8%. What should investors do? Aadhaar Housing Finance shares have gained sharply, rising more than 6% in intraday trade. Read on to know the factors driving the surge and what it means for investors.

Bajaj Housing Finance IPO: Check price band, issue size, dates and GMPThe price band for Bajaj Housing Finance IPO is set between Rs 66 and Rs 70 per share. Retail investors must apply for a minimum of 214 shares, requiring a minimum investment of Rs 14,980.
World Bank upgrades India's FY25 GDP forecast to 7%Looking ahead, the World Bank expects India's medium-term outlook to remain positive, with strong growth projected for FY26 and FY27.
Premier Energies shares turn multibagger on debut. What investors need to knowPremier Energies made a blockbuster debut, doubling IPO investors' wealth. Here's what you need to know.

HAL shares soar as Cabinet clears Rs 26,000 crore order. Check target priceThe order is expected to boost HAL's order backlog from Rs 94,000 crore to Rs 1.2 lakh crore, providing strong revenue visibility, according to a report by Antique Stock Broking.

Raymond Group plans IPO listings for apparel, real estate units by 2025: ReportRaymond Group IPOs: Chairman Gautam Singhania recently explained that the restructuring is intended to address what he described as "subdued valuations" due to the varied nature of Raymond's portfolio.

GST panel recommends tax relief for foreign airlinesThis proposal follows extensive deliberations by the fitment committee and could offer substantial relief to foreign airlines currently facing tax demands from the Directorate General of GST Intelligence (DGGI).

Premier Energies shares turn multibagger on market debut: Hold or sell?Premier Energies listing: The shares opened at Rs 990 on the NSE, marking a premium of 120% over its issue price of Rs 450. The shares opened at a premium of 120.22% on BSE, listing at Rs 991.

These 15 stocks have gained over 200% in just 5 monthsAmong the top gainers, LCC Infotech has emerged as a standout, seeing its shares skyrocket by 362% from Rs 1.90 on March 28, 2024, to Rs 8.77 on August 30, 2024.

Can Reko Diq's gold mine end Pakistan's economic crisis? Reko Diq is one of the world's largest undeveloped copper and gold reserves, with the potential to produce 200,000 tons of copper and 250,000 ounces of gold annually for over half a century.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: IC 814 survivors say Netflix series has 'shown the truth', but there is a catchRakesh and Pooja Kataria, who spoke to India Today TV, were a young couple at the time of the incident. They were returning home from their honeymoon in Nepal. The couple asserted that the codenames used for the hijackers in the Netflix series is true.

India wins 20 medals, betters Tokyo for best-ever Paralympics tallyIndia added 5 medals to their tally with a late surge on Tuesday, September 2 with Deepthi Jeevanji and Sharad Kumar shinning at the Paris Paralympics 2024. India's total medals in Paris at the end of day 6 was 20.

Actor Nivin Pauly on sexual assault charges: 'Will prove my innocence'Malayalam actor Nivin Pauly was accused of sexual assault recently. He called for a press conference on September 3 and called the charges a conspiracy to defame him.

IC 814 hijack, indecision, and 'goof-ups': Former RAW chief on what went wrongSpeaking to India Today TV, AS Dulat, the former chief of Research and Analysis Wing (RAW), admitted that there were "goof-ups" when it came to decision-making and the hijacked IC 814 plane shouldn't have been allowed to leave Amritsar.
Does the expiry date really mean the food product has expired?A food product nearing its expiry date may make you wary, but experts suggest there are exceptions.

Kolkata rape case: Doctors' unique way of asking police to 'grow a spine'A delegation of junior doctors, protesting against the Kolkata rape-murder, asked the police to grow a backbone, but in a unique way — by presenting them with an artificial spine.

Man accused of raping partner cites live-in agreement, gets pre-arrest bailThe man produced a Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) that the woman had allegedly signed. The document claimed that the two had entered into a contractual live-in relationship for 11 months from August 1.

Shivaji statue collapse: Nearly 10 days later, sculptor Jaydeep Apte yet to be tracedJaydeep Apte, a 24-year-old sculptor from Kalyan, has not been located since the Shivaji statue collapsed on August 26.

One hijacker asked us to convert: IC 814 survivor on what Netflix series missedPooja Kataria, who was on the hijacked IC 814 flight, said that one of the terrorists asked the passengers to convert to Islam.

Sathyabama welcomes the Yorker Champion Jasprit BumrahIn a memorable event, Sathyabama University had the honour of hosting one of India's most celebrated cricket icons, Mr. Jasprit Bumrah. The university's President, Dr. Marie Johnson, and Chancellor, Dr. Mariazeena Johnson, warmly welcomed the champion fast bowler, renowned for his impeccable yorkers, to the campus.

The atmosphere was electric as students gathered in large numbers, eager to catch a glimpse of the cricket sensation. Their excitement and enthusiasm were palpable, reflecting the immense respect and admiration they hold for Bumrah. His visit not only inspired the students but also created an unforgettable experience, further strengthening the bond between sports and academia at Sathyabama University.

Bengaluru student assaulted by seniors for refusing to shave beard, case filedA student of Krupanidhi Group of Institutions in Bengaluru was assaulted by his seniors for refusing to shave his beard and moustache. A case has been filed against three accused.
Air India Express staff assaulted by female passenger at Mumbai airportA passenger at Mumbai airport, on September 1, misbehaved with a staff member of ground operations partner of Air India Express.

Woman cop assaulted, her hair pulled during protest: Caught on camera When some of the protesters tried to block the road, DSP Gayathri and other police personnel tried to disperse them. This led to an altercation, during which a man pulled the DSP's hair.

Going to the gym on vacation is tough. You can still work out thoughPlanning a vacation but worried that your much-awaited trip might disrupt your fitness routine and set back your progress? Here's how you can stay on track while fully enjoying your getaway.

Zomato agent brings 2-year-old daughter to work, Starbucks employee shares storyA Starbucks employee posted an appreciation note for a Zomato delivery agent who arrived at their Khan Market outlet with his two-year-old daughter to pick up an order.

Blood stains, 200 pieces of evidence: Chargesheet against actor Darshan todayThe evidence collected by the police in the murder case against Kannada actor Darshan includes a photograph allegedly retrieved from the phone of an accused, where Renukaswamy can be seen pleading to the accused not to beat him.

No pension for defectors: Himachal Pradesh introduces new bill in AssemblyA bill was introduced in the Himachal Pradesh Assembly on Tuesday aimed at stopping pension benefits for members disqualified under the anti-defection law.

PM Modi 'delighted' after meeting Sultan of Brunei: Will further expand tiesPrime Minister Narendra Modi's ongoing visit to Brunei, a key partner in India's 'Act East' Policy and Indo-Pacific Vision, is the first by an Indian head of state. The two nations have had diplomatic ties for 40 years.

Woman hit by SUV in Mumbai, succumbs even as driver rushes her to hospitalA woman was hit by a speeding SUV on Tuesday night in Mumbai's Malad area. After the incident, the car driver himself rushed her to a nearby hospital where she was declared dead by doctors.

sports.headline: PM Modi dials Sheetal Devi, Yogesh Kathuniya for Paralympics glory run Prime Minister Narendra Modi congratulated India's Para-athletes like Sheetal Devi and Yogesh Kathuniya for the medal wins at the Paris Paralympics 2024 with a heartfelt call, celebrating India's growing success at the Games.

Injury haunts valiant Dimitrov, Tiafoe vs Fritz in all-American semisUS Open 2024: Frances Tiafoe returned to the semi-final in New York for the first time since 2022 after his opponent, Grigor Dimitrov, retired with an injury in the quarter-final on Tuesday. Tiafoe will face compatriot Taylor Fritz in the first all-American semi-final at a Grand Slam since 2005.

Who is Deepthi Jeevanji? Sprinter overcomes challenges to win Paralympics bronzeDeepthi Jeevanji showed her resilience on September 3, Tuesday, to clinch the bronze medal at the Paris Paralympics 2024. Deepthi, a world champion, continued her ascend in the world of athletics with the win.

Navarro, who had knocked out Coco Gauff in the previous round, will take on either Aryana Sabalenka or Qinwen Zheng.

Sumit Antil reveals Neeraj Chopra's message which helped him win gold in ParisStar javelin thrower Sumit Antil defended his gold medal in Paris Paralympics. After the event, Sumit revealed that a message from Neeraj Chopra helped him stay in focus during the event.

Shan Masood comments on Babar Azam's lean patch after Bangladesh series lossPakistan captain Shan Masood commented on Babar Azam's poor form after his team's 0-2 series loss against Bangladesh in Rawalpindi.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
